intro: Hieracium haematopodum subsp. coloratipes, commonly known as the red-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its reddish stems and yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant has hairy leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds.
